alert.note: Alert for Knox; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Stark and northern Knox Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Annawan to near Woodhull. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wataga, Oneida and Altona. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 34 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
